definition: to ascend/to rise to the rank of/to promote/to hoist/liter/measure for dry grain equal to one-tenth dou 斗[dou3]
variant of 升[sheng1]/to ascend/to rise in rank

sentences.english: Schnoor said prices soared threefold in early 2008.
sentences.chinese: 斯诺说，在2008年早期，价格飙升至原来三倍。

sentences.english: This year the tally had soared to 212.
sentences.chinese: 今年这个数字飙升至212处。

sentences.english: I sense ticket sales spiking across the country.
sentences.chinese: 我感觉这下全国的彩票销售都要飙升了。

sentences.english: As oil prices skyrocketed, Gaddafi and his family suddenly had more money than they knew what to do with.
sentences.chinese: 得利于油价的飙升，卡扎菲家族身价倍增。

sentences.english: Oil price skyrockets in China these days.
sentences.chinese: 这几天中国的油价飙升。

sentences.english: There's no hockey-stick upturn in digital downloads.
sentences.chinese: 数字音乐下载量不会出现飙升了。

sentences.english: Only in Canada will the temperature skyrocket to 29 degrees celsius.
sentences.chinese: 只有在加拿大气温将飙升至29摄氏度。

sentences.english: Her success at the Brit Awards merely confirmed her surging popularity.
sentences.chinese: 此次在全英音乐奖上的成功再次证实了她飙升的人气。

sentences.english: CRH levels are also known to soar during pregnancy.
sentences.chinese: 在孕期，CRH水平也是公认会飙升的。

sentences.english: Since the acquisition of the Greek vase, the prices of antiquities have shot skyward.
sentences.chinese: 自从收购这只希腊花瓶以来，古董的价格一路飙升。

sentences.english: Several factors have rocketed the price of cheese higher in short order.
sentences.chinese: 多种因素已造成奶酪价格在短期内进一步飙升。

sentences.english: According to some estimates the ratio of bad loans in the banking system could shoot up almost to 10 per cent.
sentences.chinese: 据估计，银行系统的坏账率将飙升至10%。

sentences.english: Demand for physical and non-physical gold in China is soaring.
sentences.chinese: 中国市场实物黄金和纸黄金的需求量飙升。

sentences.english: Powerchip ended up 6% in Taipei trading, for example.
sentences.chinese: 周四，力晶半导体在台湾股市收盘飙升6%。

sentences.english: Stress creeping up in your life?
sentences.chinese: 压力是否在你的生活中飙升？

sentences.english: But with prosperity, rates of crime have also soared.
sentences.chinese: 但是伴随着经济的繁荣，犯罪率也飙升了。

definition: to clamber up/(of prices etc) to rise
(of water) to soar/(of prices) to skyrocket
the tide rises, the boat floats (idiom); fig. to change with the overall trend/to develop according to the situation
to surge up/to rise/(of tensions etc) to run high
